\begin{align} f(x) &= \log (\log x), x\gt 1 \\ \implies \dfrac{d}{dx}f(x) &= \underbrace{\dfrac{d}{d\log x}\log(\log x) \cdot\dfrac{d}{dx}\log x}_{\text{Chain Rule}} \end{align} \\ \text{Also, note the standard result - }\dfrac{d}{dy}\log y = \dfrac{1}{y}.
